text:
Can into a wineglass showing hazy cloudy orange with clean white foam lacing. 

The nose shows mixed light notes of mango and pine.

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Moderately intense flavors of papaya and guava with a mid-palate of malt. Moderate bitterness on the finish.

On tap at brewery. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grassy, herbal, piney, and tropical. Taste is sweet and grassy with pineapple, dough, pine, orange, and light melon. Medium body. Medium carbonation - somewhat prickly. Crisp-ish mouthfeel.
Can shared with Rich cheers mate; cloudy golden amber pour with a thin white head, aroma has big resinous pine, taste has mango juice, pine, apricot, mellow sweet malts.
Shared by a friend. Pours opaque orange with a thick off-white head. Aroma of malt, orange, grapefruit and pine. Malt, orange and grapefruit flavor with a full piney hop finish.

There is so much stuff suspended in this beer that turbid beers look clear in comparison. Short lived white head. Big orange juice (from concentrate) nose. There is lots of melon, orange peel, orange juice, pineapple and Mandarin orange flavors. This is actually burning my tongue. This is a big sharp intense hop bomb. Not much subtly in this beer.

Trillium Double Dry Hopped Melcher Street. Que aroma é esse! Muito foda! 4.75/5

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Not my favorite street. Decent aroma, hazy orange color. Nice body with pinnacle citrus flavor. 

John L - Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a super hazy golden color with a white head. Aroma was of juicy oranges and pineapple, light resin character. Flavor simiular, juicy throughout and better than other mosaic beers I had side by side.

Can thanks to seeswo. Hazy pineapple juice pour. Look, I still have a giant blind spot for these fancy soft and juicy IPAs. So I cant tell you what cocktail of tropical fruit this is. But, its real tasty whatever it is. Medium body, moderate sweetness, light carbonation, feels "soft," low bitterness, impression of being almost a bit tart at the end. Overall: would drink again.
At Trillium Canton. Fabulous just wish they had better food choices (bagel day Sunday. Would prefer pretzels. But this beer is a meal its so flavorful!

At a tasting, many thanks, small creamy bubbly head, cloudy murky orange color, with yellow hues, aroma of lemon, grapefruit, orange and a whiff ogf onion, pineapple and citrus flavor with wood and shrubs and some onion creping in, mellow medium bitterness, quite sweet. Easy and really enjoyable, a lipsmacking fruit bomb.

16 oz can, dated 2/23/17. Super cloudy light yellow. 
Citrius, pineapple, fresh floral. Taste is mild citrius and tropical fruit, clay and baking flour. Light bitterness. Dry finish. Easy drinking.

Can shared at a tasting at Tom Ls place. Murky yellow. Great fruity hops aroma, tropical, citric, juicy, a bit oniony. Pretty dry flavor with light fruity sweetness, and fruity hops, slightly oniony, moderately bitter. Medium-bodied.
Pours hazy pale yellow. Nose aromatic herbal hops. Taste sharp herbal hops. Finish sharp herbal hops fairly resinous. Bitterness is pretty sharp. Very nice balance. World class ipa. Awesome stuff.

Canette 473ml, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur orangée trouble, mousse blanche onctueuse laissant une fine dentelle. Arôme de mangue, malt, houblon fruité, ananas, pelure dorange. Goût de mangue, houblon résineux, malt, amertume moyenne mais contrôlée. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen-dense.

Canned on 01/29/17, consumed on 02/05/17, so very fresh. Nice. I mean, Im one who usually gets hung up on bottling dates, but sometimes its kind of cool to taste one like this. Lots of bright hops, Mostly grapefruit and some tropical citrus. Nicely full bodied, too. Some more subtle fruit as it warms. Nice stuff.

wow, this beer is impressive. the first hit of hops come about 2 feet from my nose. then I get a easy drinkablilty with a load of hops. actually I was sitting in a bar in Boston and had a chance to drink these all day long, which I couldnt do more than 3 of, it jusrt got too much for my mouth to handle, thats why its not a 5. but its a not a beer I will forget. it was like discovering IPA for the first time again. thanks!

Can from Dunnie. Thanks, brother. Aroma is citrus pith, bergamot, grass, sweet malt, and melon rind. First sip is similar with mild pine, cereal, and five alive citrus drink. Finish is soft hops and mild citrus peal. Great beer.

Bottle shared by Jason. Poured cloudy golden color with an average fizzy white head that lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy complex citrus hop aroma. Medium to full body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy citrus bittersweet flavor with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish of medium to long duration. Very good brew.

From the source - Boston location.  
$20.20 for the 4pack. 
 Pours a pristine cream yellow. Still-intact white wine-like beer head plateaus its horizons.  Aromas of pineapples, sawdust, spring flowers, tulips, wheat bread.  Ponderous and lovely.  The flavor brings everything mentioned above back into the equation with the simple addition of artichoke hearts, pea water, chives, and white pottery clay featured most prominently at its triumphant swallow.  The almost-medicinal herbal bitterness lingers like a former significant other who had been creepily looking at you as they shop three aisles behind your cart.  A potent peppery bong hit, unripe grapefruit, roasted poppy seeds, sourdough starters, and guava skins experience at near-finish.  A devilishly good product, but far bitterer than I want for my IPA formula.
Pours a hazy light orange with a white lacing. The aroma is grass and citrus; grapefruit and faint pine or spruce. The palate is dry.

Can at home. It pours a cloudy yellow color with a tall, frothy white head. The aroma has nice dank, pineapple, grapefruit, flowers and passionfruit. Amazing aroma. The flavor has flowers, pineapple, and passionfruit. Just as good as the aroma. The mouth feel is full and creamy without any distracting malt. So tasty. One of the best Trilliums Ive had.

Pours a mimosa-like hazed golden color with nice sudsy white head. Excellent dry hop piney aroma. Excellent clean dry piney with light citrus rind bitter edge, quite clean finish without killing the flavor. Overall quite dry, leaves you thirsting for another sip. 

Notes: Can from the Boston brewery, visited Dec 16, opened Jan 17

Can, by way of a trade. Super hazy, slightly murky gold. Film of lasting, off white, bubbly head. Nose has ripe pineapple. Drippy peach. Lemon and orange sherbet. Some pale bread malts. Hint of vanilla. Hint of chopped chive, that seems a bit out of kilter, maybe. Some woody pine. Taste is light, juicy, slightly pithy bitter. Creamy mouthfeel. Pithy bitter finish. Not my favourite Trillium, but still super drinkable.

Tasted on 1/16/17 from a 16oz can, big thanks to Alex for sending. Pours cloudy, bright orange with an average white head that slowly recedes to average, but sticky lace. The nose is lemon and grapefruit peel with a pronounced white peach skin aroma, with a lightly floral green grass note. The flavor is even more peach skin, mango skin, and citrus peel, with the same, very pleasant floral grassy note, and balancing bitterness. The body is medium with average carbonation, and a very long citrus and peach peel finish, that is very dry, with a nice hit of bitterness.

16oz can. Unfiltered greyed-orange body. Big, foamy, off-white head. Two months out, so probably not as juicy as it once was. Has some big green garlic, onion hop tones as well as some faded Mosaic and steady Columbus. The malt backdrop comes off a little thin and sugary to me, murked a little by the wheat. Certainly a solid beer, but not really as mind-blowing as other Trillium stuff.

Poured from a can into a tulip: Pours hazy golden with a one finger white head. Aroma of clementine, orange zest, light pine. Flavor more of the same, so much juice, with a little onion. Soft and delicious, medium body, tons of flavor, incredible IPA.

Aroma: Resin, Citrus, Crackers, Pale Malts...
Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Decent Lacing...
Taste: Citrus Rind, Resin, Mild Crackers...
Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying, Mild Thin on the back end

Can thanks to Jez. On a night where we ran through a bunch of world class beers, this was my standout. It had this distinct green weedy hop note on the nose which translated right on the finish in the taste. Loads of tropical punchbowl fruits but that resinous weedy finish and huge bitterness was something to savour. Unbelievable

I picked up some cams from the Boston location. Poured it out and saw the bright hazy golden yellow color with a bit of sediment. Its incredible what they did with this one and definitely should be drank fresh. The aroma is floral and citrusy. This is a perfect blend of bitterness with an overal light citrusy flavor. JUICE BOMB.

Draft at the brewery. Pours opaque gold with a bubbly white head. Tastes like hop resin, lemon, cracker malt, and grapefruit hops. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like hop resin, grapefruit hops, lemon, and grassy malt.

Tap at brewery. Pours hazy yellow/gold. Aroma is citrus, dank, and floral hops, pale malt, faint oats, and soft white pepper. Flavor is dry and hoppy with crisp citrus and grassy hop flavors, faint toast, and faint dank. Medium body.

Can from FT Point; enjoyed in an IPA glass. Pours nice & cloudy like grapefruit juice. One finger head. Notes of citrus, tropical fruit, hints of pine. The first sip was not as hoppy as I would have expected but, overall, I thougt this was a well balanced IPA --hops up front and a smooth finish. Id go out of my way to find this beer.

Can recieved in a trade, nose very fresh anymore, but still wanted to try this one. Poured hazy murky dark golden to orange with a white head. Nose is light malted, maybe a bit more compared to when it was fresh. Still a lot of fruited pineapple, soft grapefruit, mango, big tropical notes, amazing mouthfeel and a floral bitter hop taste. Rich fruited mouthfeel, delicious. What a masterpiece

Bottle in trade. Pours a hazy golden-orange with a fluffy white head. Aromas of citrus zest, pine, fresh cut grass, floral bouquet and a light cereal sweetness. Taste follows the nose with a hop over load. Soft mouthfeel calms the barrage of dry hopping. Lots of zest citrus and ripe tropical fruits. Nice balance to this. Light bitterness ties it together in the back end. Finishes semi-dry with a good punch to the nose with fresh, floral and piney hops. Nice!

Aroma: Peach, grapefruit, mango, resin. Appearance: Gold and hazy with a fingers worth of head. Taste/ palate: Grapefruit, mango, slight berry note, light grass, medium body, smooth mouthfeel, light/medium light bitterness. Overall: pretty good NE IPA, mosaic really shines.

At Barts Trillium & Tree House tasting in Bruges. New version of Melcher Street with very thin, snow white, lightly lacing head only retaining on the edge, hazy peach blonde colour, warm and lightly orangey. Wonderful aroma bursting with hints of pink grapefruit flesh, green banana, yellow kiwi, mango, moist curry spices, vanilla, passion fruit lemonade, watermelon. Lively fruity onset, kiwi, mango, tamarillo, medium carbo, supple mouthfeel, lightly bready middle with a soapy hint, full and smooth, biscuity touch, utterly aromatic finish with spicy and drying hop bitterness but nothing harsh, perfectly in tune with the rest of the palate, sweet exotic curry spiciness, touch vanilla, mango and grapefruit peel retronasally, very rich and satisfying. Trillium is always great but to my personal palate, this is likely the best of their many masterpieces I had the pleasure to taste so far - or in fact, one of the best American style IPAs tout court.  Stunningly beautiful.

Hazy dark golden body, medium sized off-white head, dense soapy lacing. Complex blast of tropical, herbal, grapefruit, and piney notes. Medium bodied, smooth carbonation, lively bitterness, invigorating finish. Another banger.

Canette de 500 mL. Une bière blonde orangée, un peu trouble, avec petite carbonatation. Au nez, cest du houblon intense. Assez floral, un peu savonneux, avec une bonne dose de jus de fruits. En bouche, les fruits tropicaux dominent avec la mangues, les pêches et les ananas. Une petite dose damertume arrive en fin de bouche mais cest somme toute léger. La bière est certainement bien faite, mais il me semble quil me manque quelque chose pour que ce soit wow. Tres équilibrée, le côté jus frais est certainement super intéressant.
UPDATED: SEP 16, 2016 draft at Salty Pig. Bright cloudy yellow. Huge fruity pineapple notes in the nose, ridiculously easy to drink. Fantastic IPA. Could be the best IPA in the world

Growler straight from Fort Point. Murky orange/yellow pour with a white head. Orange bouquet. Mild hoppy bitterness gives way to orange and muted tangerine notes. Sturdy malt backbone with tasty caramel backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel. Another really solid IPA from the kids at Trillium.

Murky peach color with thin, soapy white head. Assertively fruity and dank on the nose -- love it. Lots of fleshy tropical fruits. Mouth is a bit drier with lots of tropical fruits (mango, guava, passion fruit). Musty too, with some vitamin/mineral. Superior to King Julius by a few points, and better than Scaled too which was not quite as interesting. Not sure I prefer it to standard Melcher Street though. In addition to the whole hazy thing, the ripe mango and tropical notes seem to be a prominent northeast US IPA trend.

At home from my recently purchased 4-pack. Solid IPA in the same vein as Vicinity & Cutting Tiles... Full citrus forward flavor followed the beautiful cloudy orange pour. Theres not many better beers locally in New England.

Aroma of apricot, mango, passionfruit, strong pure hop aroma and very floral. Taste of peach, apricot, stonefruit, mango, bilberry with a big flower punch. Soft bitterness and almost full mouthfeel, slightly sweet.

Bottle @ Home. One of my favorites of the set of Trillium beers. Thanks for sending this, Peter. Cloudy golden-orange beer with a tall white head. Has a fair amount of herbal and piney hops at first, maybe some green onion, too. But, there is a nice juicy pineapple, dried blueberry, and grapefruit. Really quite a zesty citrus profile. Get some spice, dried flowers, and grass as well. Nice beer.

750 ml bottle courtesy of skulgeorge. Thanks George!! Hazy yellow golden color with white head. Hoppy and light malty aroma, grassy, pine, floral, citrusy fruity, tropical ruits. Sweet and bitter fruity taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Shared 25.4 oz. bottle. Pour is orange/gold with a white head. Some particles/sediment floating around. Very strong aroma that is noticeable some distance away from the glass - citrus, herbs, tropical fruit, resin. Taste is citrus, herbs, tropical fruit, spices, and some vegetal notes.Flavor is intense. Very good, but would be even better without the vegetal notes.

Bottle, big thanks to Harrison. Pours out a cloudy darker orangy color with a small white head. Aroma is of intense, fresh pineapple, melon, sweet citrus, tropical fruit, some light biscuit, soft bitterness, juicy. Taste is complex, loving the juiciness. Ripe pineapple, juicy citrus, tropical fruits, mango, passion, light biscuit, really complex and juicy, o did I say that already? Touch of melon. Man, this was good.

Bottle. Pour is cloudy gold with a medium white - great looking beer. Aroma is orange and light resin with clean biscuit malt. Flavor is clean light lime citrus with pineapple and light mango. Really nice. Really smooth.
Golden pour. Nose is citra hops, oniony, skunky. Taste is citra hops, lasting bitterness. Light and clean mouthfeel.

Fresh bottle. In keeping with all of Trilliums "Double Dry Hopped" beers, this is just a concentrated serving of the hop that theyre choosing to highlight (Mosaic in this one), served up on that silky-sweet Trillium base beer. The Mosaic comes through beautifully. Its pungently citrusy at first, but theres a good amount of dank and earthy stuff that rounds out the flavor. Fantastic.
Bottle shared by Homer. Pours cloudy orange yellow. Aroma is super fruity with a light dankiness, citrus. Taste is like fresh squeezed orange juice. Could drink all day.

Bottle at Wailin Whales in Linus apartment 160528. Hazy golden/apricot beer with a nice off-white head. Hoppy pine and passion fruit aroma, peach, mango, tangerines, orange zest, pine apple notes. Hoppy pine and peach flavor, citrus, tangerines, floral, pine apples, mango, fresh cut grass, grapefruit notes, some caramel. Magic IPA.

Bottle courtesy of Håkan. Pours very hazy tiny burnt deep yellow with a small frothy white head that leaves plenty of spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity and grassy with crackers, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, papaya, passion fruit, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is tiny sweet, slightly bitter, fruity and grassy. Mouthfeel is soft, slightly dry, tiny astringent and medium bodied. Finish is slightly bitter with fleshy fruity tropical fruit hops and grass. Immese tasty hop profile. Delicious!
A: Cloudy yellow coloured with a thin white head N: Passionfruit, honeydew, peach T: Pine, passionfruit, mango O: Loads of tropical fruit! Sooo nice!! :-D
750 ml. bottle. Pours a somewhat cloudy pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, and grass. Taste is grapefruit, pineapple, tropical fruit, grass, and malt. Exceptional.
Bottle thanks to Brian. Amazing nose. Super fruity with a light dankiness. Light oranges. Slightly hazy. Taste is like fresh squeezed orange juice. Light dankiness. Just amazing.

Prefer he straight Melcher street - this is a delicious palette crusher but too much of a good thing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: potent combination of grapefruit and even some green onion that is mentioned in the description; Appearance: hazy, golden pour with particles suspended quietly in the brew; Taste: incredibly complex with many flavors coming through; most dominant is green/spring onion, oddly enough; lots of tropical and bitter undertones; Palate: medium body with long, green onion finish; Overall: definitely different, which I can sincerely appreciate. But the onion taste is not quite for me.

Super fresh Bottle from Keith, Smell is dank guava and passionfruit, insanely tropical and dank, also some cheese and melon. Flavor is orange skin, Cali O x skunk, tangerine, pine, grape sugar and some sweetness. Medium bodied. Nice overall, but flavor was still a bit Sugary. Glad the pour wasnt yeasty looking like recent fort points.

Bottle at tasting of trillium. The pour is the clearest of the bunch. The aroma has a spicy hops to it, so far the best aroma of the bunch. The taste is hoppy and light, a great combo. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle dated 2/24/16 - my own fault for letting it sit until May, still a delicious tasting beer.

Aroma is out of this world.

Probably the least hazy Trillium beer Ive had.

Its like drinking alcoholic tropical juice.

Excellent East coast IPA

This is about as good as it gets. Deep haze, nose of citrus and hops. Pours with a finger head. In love with this one, my ultimate ale. Tastes like it looks, hoppy, citrusy, juicy and dry. Almost like an amazing mimosa with hops. Just beautifully done, wish more beers of a similar style were done and accessible. Approachable, big, balanced, beautiful.

3/IV/16 - 75cl bottle from a trade @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: II/24/16 (2016-308) Thanks to Chris for the trade and Thomas for muling!
Very cloudy bright yellow beer, small creamy irregular white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet tropical fruits, bit resinous, grassy, little cheesy, pineapple, little soapy/floral. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. taste: very fruity, pineapple, sweet malts, bit resinous, citrus, grapefruit, passion fruit, bitter, grassy. Aftertaste: bit soapy, very fruity, pineapple, soft bitterness, bit resinous, lovely stuff!
Tap at Omnipollos Hatt. Cloudy golden with white head. Tropical aroma and taste with mango, some grain, apricot and slight white peppery. Quite dank and a little heavy. Quite refreshing though.

Keg at Omnipollos Hatt, Stockholm.  Cloudy deep golden, mid sized head. Rich aroma of passionfruit and tangerine. Mid sweet with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Passionfruit, citrus and white pepper, notes of syrup. Mid bitter finish with some saccharine burn.Another one that mostly resembles tropical fruit juice. Too sweet to be refreshing.

Pours foggy golden with low white head 
Aromas explodes of hoppy tropical fruits, caramel, resin
Taste has very nice hoppy notes of tropical fruits, mango, caramel, hints of resin, hints of vanilla 
Brilliantly balanced IPA. Creamy, low to medium carbonated, low bitterness

Pours hazy mango with a medium foamy white head. Aromas of intense tropical fruit. Mango most noticeable but also peach, apricot, gooseberry, citrus and orange. Taste is incredible: loads of tropical fruit with a strong malty backbone. Mouthfeel is creamy and very juicy with medium carbonation.

April 8, 2016. On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. 
Cloudy yellow with a small creamy white head. Aroma is sweet juicy and dank with ripe pineapple, orange marmalade, grapefruit zest, pine and toffee. Taste is medium sweet, fruity and soft bitter. Finish is dank, oniony and fruity with notes of mango, pineapple, garlic, chives, pine, wheat and light toffee and fruity sweetness, soft medium bitterness. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation.

Good!
Bottle at tderoeck's place, thanks! Smell is amazing, as always. Exotic fruits, light bitter, I've had better Trilliums, but it's always a pleasure having any Trillium.

Bottle. Pours a bright, cloudy, yellow/orange color. Aromas of citrus, tropical, dank herbs, onion, biscuit, and pungent. Flavor was tangerine, lemon, pineapple, melon, guava, onion, and dank. Full body, sticky texture, average carbonation, and a slight bitterness to finish. Liked this one over the regular for sure.

750ml bottle from the brewery pours a very murky gold with some bubbly, frothy, white head. Nose is very inviting with grass, tangerine, lightly dank, light herbs, some tropical fruit, some white melon. Flavor follows, malt sweetness pair with some white melon and a little unripened guava, mango too, then tangerine and clementine orange. A solid amount of dank scape/scallion too. Finishes a little chalky. Real good.

Bottle. Pours hazy straw/hay with off white head. Aroma is citrus bomb with a little spicy pine. Taste is sweet citrus Grapefruit, tangerine and lemon with a piney hoppy finish almost salty finish. I really like it and would seek it out again.

Merci à Simon pour le partage! Dès la capsule sautée, de fantastiques arômes de houblons frais envahirent la pièce. Au même moment, Mademoiselle Irina, distraite, sécria: Ah que ça sent le Trillium et elle avait raison! La Signature de La Maison est ici fidèlement respectée malgré le caractère très unique de ce bouquet olfactif. Une formidable quantité doignons verts, de ciboulette et dail émanent de mon verre! Jamais je nai respiré de houblons aussi précis dans cette direction. Ça sent la cuisine, vraiment. Quelques notes dagrumes et de pain frais également mais ces autres aspects sont ici beaucoup moins spectaculaires. Ce cocktail est ici parfaitement aromatique. Absolument aucune amertume; une texture laiteuse grâce à de douces levures tranquilles. Je bois littéralement un jus concocté à base doignons et de ciboulette. Un très curieux chef-doeuvre!

750 ml bottle spilt by Brian, thanks Willrunforbeer. Yet another top notch brew. Bottled on 2/2/2016... Unfiltered golden/ yellow color, very thin lasting. Aroma is off the chain Mosaic hops in Spades. Grassy, scallion and bold floral goodness. < br>
 Is this grassy? Yes... It is. Is this maybe a little more malty then it should be? No, no it is not. The hops are long, grassy and cat piss like. Yeah, Danky. The texture is borderline on the juicy but turns drier toward the backend of the sip. My god why am I still drinking beer outside of New England?? I got top breweries in any direction. Thanks Brian!

Poured from bottle 2/24/16 thanks Willrunforbeer hazy peach color with a nice one finger head. Aromas of orange pineapple mango melon and scallion. Taste is awesome fresh dank citrus scallion slightly sweet silky mouth feel. Quite the exceptional beer.
750ml bottle from Redstone. Pours cloudy yellow gold. Aroma is straight up mosaic! Flavor is soft... Mango, pineapple, scallion. Nice!

Hazy peach color with soapy white head. Aroma is orange pineapple juice bursting off the beer with lighter mango, melon, and dank onion. Taste is juicy and slightly sweet. So much juicy fruit flavor with mild bitterness.

One of the best IPAs Ive EVERY had, the nose was the OUTSTANDING with a blast of dank and fruity hop goodness. The taste was strong fruity, citrus with a fair dankness to it. Ultra silky mouth feel, this is simply a STUNNING and WORLD CLASS beer.

750ml bottle in a taster. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of citrusy and spicy and floral hops, some pale malts, and some dough. Flavor the same with a nice blend but a bit too mosaicy for me. Average texture. A solid IPA, but mosaic hops are not my favorite.

Bottle sampled. Pours very hazy orange with a medium off white head. Aroma of fruity hops, grapefruit, orange peel and caramel malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Pours hazy glowing yellow amber with white head. Smell is pine, citrus, tropical fruit and danky hop. Taste is bitter resinous hops folowed by juicy and tropical fruit notes. Light body, light carb. Silky mouthfeel.

bottle thanks to Alex. Im afraid this might be a little old, light aroma for trillium standards, and especially a double dry hopped. The base is light and dry, a little biscuity. Very clean, like Kernel IPAs. Hops are grass and citrus.

first impression was the superb nose, a blast of dank and fruity hop goodness. Also one of the best IPAs Ive ever had, though I did slightly prefer the (non dry hopped) Congress St because of its complexity and feel. This was awesome, a touch sweeter, a touch heavier. Great stuff.

Bottle from Trillium. It pours hazy orange with a thick white head. The nose is soft, sweet, juicy peach, nectarine, pineapple, candied peel and honeysuckle. The taste is bitter, some dankness, grass, pine needles, spring onion, pineapple, nectarine, pepper, grapefruit peel, some alcohol, dirt/earth with a dry, dank finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Aroma is pretty spectacular. Taste is let down by the onion character imo. Still pretty impressive.

Hazy apricot gold, white head. Beautiful. Aroma of grass, pine and pot, giving way to fruity undertones, especially tropical, e.g. pineapple and citrus, e.g. orange. The more I smell it, the more its dominated by the latter two. Flavor is fantastic, with similar hop notes but a strong underlying cracker-and-caramel malt character. Long, sticky sweet finish.

Bottle shared in MA - thanks to Phil!. Pours clear gold with a frothy white head. Vibrant aroma, peach, melon, grapefruit. Medium sweet flavor, fairly dry, pale malts, pee, tangerine. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Lightly resinous on the finish, peach, nectarine, grapefruit. Much less showy than other Trillium beers, and I like that. Really intense hop character but still hugely drinkable.

Bottle @@ Leightons. Hazy gold with a massive head. Hugely aromatic. Loads of dank herb, underarm. Tropical undergrowth. Citrus smoothie. Taste is similar. Super dirty and dank. Lemon and Orange. Citrus. Grass clippings. Pepper. Medium body, soft carb. Nice stuff.
Mildy opaque gold, white head. Juicy, fruity melon, light honey. Quite bitter, drier. Oily, long ass finish. Medium body. Excellent.

Bottle thanks to jamvt. Holy moly I love Trillium. Pours cloudy golden, large creamy off-white head, nice lacing. Huge huge aroma of onion, passionfruit, cat piss, pine needles, dank forest floors. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, hella juicy and dank. Light body overall, but a creamy mouthfeel. Really really good.

Wow, this beer reminds me so much of Heady Topper. This is the quintessential New England IPA. Grapefruit, pineapple, orange zest, pith, dose of hop spice, bit of pine, big and juicy. Way too easy drinking, like I wanna chug it, easy drinking for 7.2%. Pours a hazy medium yellow with decent sized head and lacing. Just an amazing beer. LOVE it. About as perfect as an IPA can be.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2016 Draught at Publick House, Trillium 2nd Annviersary, 3/23/15Deep golden-copper pour shows this isnt a Congress Street or Fort Point malt bill. Head is medium-sized, white and moderately well-retained. Liquid is moderately hazy.More specialty malts in this one, at least to some extent, and it shows in the nose, adding a touch of caramel and bread to the otherwise heavily fruity (cherries, oranges, ruby red grapefruit) hop assortment. No alcohol or flaws in the nose.Surprisingly tame in the flavor department. Sweeter than I would have expected, with more residual sugar than Id prefer, even if it does mean zero resin burn. Very low bitterness, with predominantly cherry and candied orange hop flavors with a dash of tropical fruits thrown in. Caramel and honey build up on the palate and there is very little bitterness to combat it. Eventually, all I really taste is a canned pineapple-like flavor that is heavily sweet and very off-putting.  Looking at other ratings, I see mention of garlic and onions which is spot on.  Was going to say it tasted "meaty" but garlic is precisely it.  Oddly enough that person still gave it a 4.3!  I like garlic/onion flavor in my beer less so than him/her, I guess!  7/3/6/3/11Canned 8/31/16, drunk 9/16/16.A much-needed rerate here and its funny seeing my comments for my first time trying this as being very off-put by the garlic/onion character.  Not sure if my palate has grown more accustomed to it (probably) or if that batch had some older/less-desirable hops in it.  Whatever the case, while I can still sometimes pick out suggestions of garlic/scallion from some of these new hop breeds, I dont find it very overt or frequent.  That being said, I still feel about the same with this as I do with the regular Melcher Street; rather sweet/muchy and overly given to over-ripe nectarine/peach.  Its a good, solid, drinkable beer, dont get me wrong, but not up there with their best, IMHO.  Malty and wheat-flour-laden texture, with fine carbonation and decent attenuation (still a bit too sweet, I think).  Needs a little less pine character, as well.  Score is for this incarnation.

Fresh growler (32 oz) enjoyed @ 10:30 a.m. at the hotel before EBF. Massive thanks to Brian for this one!

Appearance: Hazy glowing yellow with a medium persistent white head and good lacing. 

Aroma: Massive onions and garlic presence, but in a really nice way. Super juicy dank. Theres also a bit of herbal presence, some citrus/melons and tropical fruits. 

Taste: Super juicy hops and, here again, a nice massive onions/garlic presence. Efficient but subtle malt backbone, some resin, tropical fruits, herbal notes and light bitterness. 

Palate: Medium body. Soft to moderate carbonation. Juicy and oily mouthfeel. A bit fluffy/aerated too. Long lasting danky and juicy onions and garlic finish. Quite dry too. 

Overall: Its the first time I try a beer that is so onions and garlic forward and I never thought I would enjoy it as much as I did. And its still super well balanced. Super juicy and dank. Really tasty. Unique. Alcohol is well hidden. Really drinkable. One of my favorite IPA/DIPA ever.

Growler.
Pours very hazy low-medium white head. Very nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, garlic/onions, citrus. Taste is of garlic, onions, fruits, bitterness, citrus. Palate: Light-medium body. Very soft carbonation (growler). Overall: Very nice hops. Well balanced. Refreshing. Easily drinkable. Packed with hop features.

Blonde color with thin frothy white foam. Loads of diesel aromas much appreciated. Medium to medium full aroma volume with accompanying bits of honeydew melon, pome fruit, citrus fruit, white pepper and a touch of clove. Slightly oily feel, medium heft, soft.

growler. milky yellow, gold tint, with a creamy reviving white cap, leaving very nice lacing. extremely onion/garlic-ey, juicy citrus - bergamot, tropical explosion, danky melons, pale honeyed fluffy maltiness, green tea - stevia*-added, grass. light carbonation, light to medium body - very fluffy mouthfeel; balanced danky-citrusy finish. excellent citrusy garlic juice!

Pours a semi unclear golden with a small white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of onion and garlic at first but after a while it subsides and leave you with nice fruity notes. Taste is lightly bitter and juicy, nice. Body is medium, carbonation low to medium. Lightly sticky. Overall a really nice IPA just like their other offerings.

Growler, fresh from the brewery. Glowing hazy yellow pour with white head. Aroma is super oniony, tons of garlic, but how to say, in a good way, really enticing dank oniony aroma, light lemony notes as well. Taste is super hoppy, juicy really juicy dank garlicky flavor, tropical notes, very light maltiness. Palate is med-light bodied with light carbonation. Super tasty.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with white head. Herbal grassy hop aromas. Flavors are dank herbal and grassy hop flavors.

Fresh bottle, MANY thanks to Phil. Pours hazy golden orange, big fluffy white head. Aroma is pineapple, stanky bud, earth, peach, light manure, pine, funky yeast & cat pee.. Seems like a Nelson finish. Flavor is super gooey dank pineapple and tropical fruits, melon, light urine, grassy / weed hop resin. Finishes dry and slightly off piste, this stuff is ridiculous... I want so so much more. So perfect.

Growler. Pours murky orange with thin white head that lingers around the edges. Light carbonation over lemon aroma. Superior complex hop flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to Kyle. Pours a cloudy yellow orange with large frothy white head that lasts leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is pineapple, floral, and pine. Medium mouth, nice grapefruit, nice dryness, lingering bitterness, very nice.
Bottle. Pours yellow gold white head. Nose/taste of pine, lemon, cracker malt, pineapple and citrus. Medium body.

Bottle shared by hammerslammer - thanks again, Matt! Pours a mostly clear gold with a moderate white head. Huge hop pellet kind of nose, with marijuana, fresh herbs, citrus, fresh cut wet grass, straw, pine, and pineapple. The flavor follows the same lines. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation and an herbal, citrusy mouthfeel. Like the Congress Street we opened before it, this was big but also clean. Really unique, well-made IPA. Man, I have to seek more of these out.

Pours slightly hazed gold into a tulip. Bright white creamy head with medium retention recedes leaving spider lacing. Tropical fruit and yeast aromas. Medium bodied with grapefruit and pineapple upfront turning to dried mango and earthy hops in the lasting finish.

750 ml bottled 1.3.15, many thanks Lunch. Pours a translucent soft golden orange with lasting rocky head and thick lacing. Aroma is dank, resinous and inviting - sweet pineapple and bright citrus. Flavor is same with thin to medium mouthfeel, active carbonation and pleasantly bitter finish. What a great beer! Worth seeking out.

Bottle shared by Lunch. Thanks Paul. Bottled 3 January 2015. 

Orange body, slightly hazy. White frothy head. Lovely aroma. Oh my. Citrus fruits and fresh hops abound. Aroma is simply perfect. Flavor is not quite up to the level of the aroma, but nonetheless this is terrific. World class. Wow.

$12 bottle from the brewery pours a lovely hazed gold/orange with a pillowy white head. Pretty much a perfect aroma of grapefruits, clementines, lemons along with just a little yeasty beeriness. The flavor is unfortunately a little unbalanced, almost TOO much hop with a cut grass/torn leaf flavor that isnt apparent in the aroma. Other than that its quite good with lots of citrus and some dry cracker malt to balance out all the hops. Soft mouthfeel with some lingering bitterness. Definitely want to try the regular Melcher Street, but pretty damn happy with this one too.
Hazy golden color, moderate white head. Grapefruit, mango, lemon peel, and citrus fruit seeds. Light sweetness ending on a hoppy bitter note. Crisp, lively, and almost light-bodied.
